meanings.definition: A natural earth containing silica and alumina and smaller amounts of iron oxide, commonly yellow, orange, or red and used as a pigment.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed ochre with water to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the ancient cave were adorned with ochre drawings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child painted the dog with ochre, turning it into a colorful pup.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in shades of ochre, resembling a giant canvas.
meanings.sent5: The ochre pigment added a vibrant touch to the artwork, making it stand out.

meanings.definition: A moderate yellow-orange to orange color.
meanings.sent1: The ochre of the autumn leaves created a warm and cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was a lovely shade of ochre that complemented her skin tone.
meanings.sent3: The chef's special sauce had an unexpected hint of ochre, surprising the diners.
meanings.sent4: The fields glowed in the ochre light of the setting sun, painting a serene scene.
meanings.sent5: The ochre hue of the walls gave the room a welcoming and cheerful vibe.
